arts.ttl: Eintracht Frankfurt earn convincing win over Galatasaray
arts.sum: Eintracht Frankfurt fight back from conceding an early goal to convincingly beat Galatasaray in their first Champions League game of the season.

arts.ttl: Five-star Eintracht Frankfurt dominate Galatasaray in Champions League opener
arts.sum: Eintracht Frankfurt defeated Galatasaray SK by a 5-1 result in the opening match of the 2025/26 UEFA Champions League. Dino Toppmöller's side scored three times in thirteen minutes in the victory.

arts.ttl: Confirmed lineups: Eintracht Frankfurt vs. Galatasaray SK
arts.sum: Eintracht Frankfurt (0-0-0) face Galatasaray SK (0-0-0) at Deutsche Bank Park on Thursday evening in their first match of the new 2025/26 UEFA Champions League campaign.

arts.ttl: 5 reasons Eintracht Frankfurt will beat Galatasaray in the UEFA Champions League
arts.sum: With 12 goals scored and three wins from their first three competitive games of 2025/26, the Eagles very much hit the ground running in the new campaign. A 5-0 DFB Cup first-round win over Engers was followed up by a 4-1 thrashing of Werder Bremen on the opening Bundesliga weekend and then a 3-1 success away to Hoffenheim .

arts.ttl: Frankfurt’s Dino Toppmöller ahead of Galatasaray clash: “It feels extraordinary”
arts.sum: Ahead of Eintracht Frankfurt’s UEFA Champions League opener against Turkish champions Galatasaray, head coach Dino Toppmöller met the press to give his thoughts on his side’s return to the promised…

Eintracht Frankfurt were unable to make a two-man advantage count on Friday night as goals from Alex Grimaldo and Patrick Schick condemned Die Adler to a 3-1 away defeat against Bayer Leverkusen. Dino...

arts.ttl: Eintracht Frankfurt vs. Galatasaray: UEFA Champions League team news and LIVE blog!
arts.sum: They got things underway with a 5-0 DFB Cup first-round win, before registering back-to-back victories in the opening two weekends of the league season - the first time they have won their first two Bundesliga fixtures of a campaign in 13 years. Enjoy some of the best Bundesliga goals scored by players who now ply their trade for Galatasaray, including Leroy Sané, İlkay Gündoğan and Kaan Ayhan.
